Finds gini values for seed/wave combinations. 

```{r}
require(plyr)
require(ggplot2)
require(ineq)

rm(list=ls(all=TRUE))

 
waveGini<-function(inputFolder,time){ 
   
  dataFrame <-(read.csv(paste(inputFolder,"exptime",time,".txt",sep=""),sep="\t",header=T))
  effect <- ddply(dataFrame,.(wave),summarise,V1=ineq((l2-l1),type="Gini"),V2=mean((l2-l1),type="Gini"))
  effect<-cbind(effect,time)  
  return(effect)
   
}
 
 
resultFolder <- "C:/Users/cxa123230/IdeaProjects/GraphBoot/results/time/"
wdata<-data.frame()
wdata<- waveGini(resultFolder,"Day")
wdata<-rbind(wdata,waveGini(resultFolder,"Night"))
 
 
  
  
resultFolder <- "C:/Users/cxa123230/IdeaProjects/GraphBoot/results/"
m13<- ggplot(wdata,aes(x=wave,y=V1,color=time))+geom_line(size=2)+scale_x_continuous(name="wave",breaks = c(0,1,2))+theme(legend.position = c(0.8, 0.8),text = element_text(size=16))+scale_y_continuous(name="Gini value")
m13<-m13+geom_point(aes(shape=time), size=4) +scale_shape_manual(values=c(0,1,2,3,4,5,6)) 
m13
ggsave(filename=paste(resultFolder,"figs/giniTime.eps",sep=""),plot=m13,width=6,height=4,unit="in")
ggsave(filename=paste(resultFolder,"figs/giniTime.png",sep=""),plot=m13,width=6,height=4,unit="in")
 
```
